We here cite some of OSBORN’s results: The amoebae are only distributed pas- sively in the host-plant (by the cell-divisions of the host- plant) — not actively as MAssEE44 assumes, Polar radiations from the nuclear spindles do not occur in Sponqospora nor centrosomes at the vegetative stage. The uninucleate nuclei of the small amoebae divide amitotically, the amoebae also divide, hence only small amoebae are found. At the close of the vegetative phase they fuse and form a plasmodium in which the nuclei disappear, so that only vacuoles remain (›>akaryote stage»); the chromatis} moves out into the plasma. Totally new nuclei are formed and these fuse two and two, The fusion-nucleus divides mitotically twice. The spores are uninucleate. —— OSBORN never succeeded in bringing the. spores to germination, but· according to MASSEE (l. c.) the contents of the spore is at the liberation of a regular roundish form with a few projecting pseudopodia.
